pages.title: Criticisms and Projections
pages.instructions: Reflect on how you judge others and what that may reveal about yourself.
prompts: What do I criticize most harshly in other people? How does that same trait or behavior show up in my own life, even if I hide it?
Think carefully here. People often hate in others what they don't want to admit exists in themselves. What are you projecting?

pages.title: Triggers and Jealousy
pages.instructions: Identify who triggers jealousy or resentment and examine why.
prompts: Who in my life triggers intense feelings of jealousy, anger, or resentment? What is it about them that stirs up those emotions in me?
What does this person represent to you? A failure you haven’t faced? A desire you’re ashamed to admit? Look closely at what they’re mirroring back to you.

pages.title: Hidden Fears and Insecurities
pages.instructions: Reflect on experiences of shame and what they reveal about you.
prompts: When was the last time I did something that made me feel ashamed or embarrassed? What did that reaction reveal about my hidden fears or insecurities?
Shame is a powerful teacher if you’re willing to listen. What are you so desperate to keep hidden that it spills out as embarrassment?

pages.title: Hidden Parts of Yourself
pages.instructions: Reflect on parts of yourself you hide and why.
prompts: What parts of myself do I work hardest to hide from others? Why am I afraid to let those parts be seen?
If you’re constantly hiding something, that part of you probably holds power over you. So what’s there?

pages.title: Feelings of Superiority
pages.instructions: Examine where you feel superior and what it might reveal about yourself.
prompts: Who do I secretly look down on or feel superior to? What does that superiority feed in me?
If you feel better than someone, ask yourself why you need that validation. What insecurity or inadequacy is it trying to cover?

pages.title: Control and Manipulation
pages.instructions: Reflect on where you control or manipulate situations to meet your needs.
prompts: In what ways do I manipulate or control people or situations to get what I want? How do I justify this to myself?
Don't kid yourself with a noble reason. What's your real motive for controlling outcomes? And what are you afraid would happen if you let go?

pages.title: Beliefs and Labels
pages.instructions: Reflect on limiting beliefs or labels you cling to.
prompts: What beliefs or labels do I cling to about myself, even if they limit me or cause me pain?
Think about the things you tell yourself repeatedly, even if they hurt. Why do you hold onto them? What part of you needs that familiar pain?

pages.title: External Validation
pages.instructions: Identify where you seek validation outside of yourself.
prompts: Where do I seek validation outside of myself? How does that reliance on external approval shape my actions?
You might tell yourself you don’t care what others think, but who are you really trying to impress? And what happens if that validation disappears?

pages.title: Feelings of Inadequacy
pages.instructions: Examine moments that make you feel unworthy.
prompts: What situations make me feel deeply unworthy or inadequate? How do I typically react in those moments?
Those reactions are clues to unresolved wounds. Where does that feeling come from? What past moment planted the seed of your inadequacy?

pages.title: Self-Sabotage and Hidden Fears
pages.instructions: Reflect on ways you sabotage yourself when close to success.
prompts: How do I sabotage myself when I get close to achieving something I want? What hidden belief or fear could be driving that self-sabotage?
Sometimes people stay stuck because succeeding would threaten their identity. What would reaching your goal force you to confront or change?
